page.title: 16Experimental Railway
page.content: The line runs from Melton Mowbray to Edwalton near Nottingham Since it is now closed to regular traffic there are no stations at either end and at least two of the old station buildings have been turned into restaurants.The track is now used by{British Rail}for testing purposes but in its heyday was owned by the London Midland and Scottish Railway and was suitable for speeds up to{100 mph. The line has been used for testing various designs including the {Advanced Passenger Train}and the{BREL {Railbus}-a new vehicle which is virtually a bus on railway wheels. Last year the line gained fame when a train was crashed into a {'flask'}for carrying{nuclear waste,}to prove that there was no chance of a full flask leaking in an accident.
